Text: Tis the season…This year we wanted tell the story of our biggest heroes – our learners. Their achievements reflect the importance of skills and training, and deserve to be celebratedStay tuned our@cityandguildsChristmas skills tale

We're delighted to have joined the celebration at tonight's Royal Lancaster Gate ceremony for@apprenticeships.

Congratulations to all the individuals and organisations recognised at this year's#AppAwards23!

Planning your#TLevelcurriculum? Watch our on-demand curriculum planning webinars. Our T Level Technical Advisors look at possible curriculum plans and delivery models. 

Watch the webinars:https://ow.ly/Sace50Qbznz

Big congratulations go out this week to Chris Crawley, who heads up City & Guilds Training Impact team, for winning the Learning, Development, and Investing in People Award at the#RailStaffAwards last Thursday.
Check out this great clip taken from the full episode.

Today is#InternationalDayOfDisabledPersonsEarlier this year we created a#NeurodiversityIndexwith@DoITProfiler– to help organisations support their neurodivergent staffThe survey is open again and we would love to hear your experience:https://cityandguildsfoundation.org/what-we-offer/campaigning/neurodiversity-index/…

We’re thrilled to announce applications for our#PrincessRoyalTrainingAwards2024are now openThe Awards were created to celebrate excellence in training. If your organisation has an innovative training programme, make sure to apply:https://princessroyaltrainingawards.com

Increase your apprenticeship completion rates with practical advice in our new Securing Apprentice success guide. 

Download the guide>https://ow.ly/QbJu50Q27HJ#apprenticeships#apprenticesuccess#EPA

Every quarter we share a newsletter to highlight what's happening across the City & Guilds Foundation

This edition covers:Our Impact ReportYoung Learner Advisory TeamPartnership with GreenworkxNeurodiversity Index 2024

Sign up:https://cityandguildsfoundation.org/category/news-and-events/newsletter/…

Last week, we had the privilege of expanding our longstanding relationship with the Ministry of Education and Youth in Jamaica as we explored new and exciting ways to support the youth of Jamaica.

We look forward to working together to expand our impact in Jamaica.

What an amazing afternoon we had at Mansion House, during the@5PercentClubUKEmployer Audit Celebration. 

It was a delight to sponsor this event which recognised so many organisations committed to apprenticeships.  

Congratulations again to all the awards winners!

What an afternoon, full of insightful discussion and delightful food!

As part of our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, yesterday our Racial Equality Community Support Groups held  the first of their lunch series. 

Special thanks to those who attended and spoke.

Are you interested in Next steps for post-16 education, training and skills in Wales?@cityandguilds' Angharad Lloyd Beynon, will be among an impressive panel discussing the priorities for education, training and research.@wfpevents@AngharadCandG

Last week we celebrated outstanding training at the#PrincessRoyalTrainingAwardsCongratulations to all recipients, including those who received our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commendations:@AcaciumGroup@AmeyLtd@netmattersltd@RockleighLtd@TayeTraining
Well done to the inspirational Carrie!
Congratulations, well done!
Keep up the fantastic work!
Thank you for your commitment.

Thank you for your message and interest, Megan. Our Learner Support team are best placed to advise on this. Please contact them via the following address. Email: learnersupport@cityandguilds.com Kind regards City & Guilds

It's always a pleasure to meeting with Shadow Minister for Skills,@SeemaMalhotra1and of course fellow Future Skills Coalition members to discuss the power of skills to changes lives, prospects and places.

Securing your apprentice's success starts from day one. 

Read our new Securing Apprentice success guide for practical advice on how you can support your learners from onboarding to end-point assessment. 

Download the guide>https://cityandguilds.com/apprenticeships/securing-apprenticeship-success…

As an employer or industry member, you can engage with#TLevelqualifications in many ways. T Levels are built around the same set of employer-led standards as apprenticeships, which puts businesses at their core. 

Read our blog post to find out more.https://ow.ly/5prE50QbRG5

A big thank you to all the providers who are delivering T Levels, those who have engaged with us on the 12-month countdown while preparing to deliver from 2024 and to the employers who have worked with us as part of EIBs and on validation activities! 

See you in January!

Looking back at 2023 - New advocates for skillsFrom@jayblades_MBE, joining us as Vice President, to our brand-new team, the Young Learner Advisory Team, 2023 has been an incredible year for bringing skills to more people.#CityandGuilds#Skills
Good luck to all the finalists. Congratulations on making it this far!

According to our Youth Misspent survey, only 36% of young people can access work experience. With a combination of classroom, workshop and substantial industry placement, in a recent article, we look at how#TLevelscould change the face of#construction.https://ow.ly/zkIQ50QbRBh

Are you thinking about adding#TLevelsto your curriculum? Our Technical Advisors are hosting a series of regional in-person events aimed at curriculum and delivery teams to provide the essential information you need about T Levels

Find an event near youhttps://ow.ly/HG5A50QbA6Y

Looking back at 2023 - Celebrating SuccessOur teams continued to empower individuals, organisations and economies by championing skill development for growthTake a look at some of our highlights, then learn more about what we do here:https://cityandguildsfoundation.org/about-us/our-impact/…

We’re thrilled to announce that we've been awarded the distinguished Cynnig Cymraeg endorsement from the Welsh Language Commissioner@AngharadCandGhttps://cityandguilds.com/news/december-2023/cynnig-cymraeg-recognition-awarded-to-city-and-guilds-for-efforts-to-improve-welsh-language-services…

Looking back at 2023 -#Voicefor SkillsWe’re committed to being a voice for skills – and this year, we were louder than ever.From getting in front of parliament to bringing the first#SkillsHubto party conferences 2023 was a great year for championing skills.
We wish you a#MerryChristmasand look forward to seeing you on our return on 2 January.#CityAndGuilds

Looking back at 2023 – Our PeopleFrom charity bike rides to celebrating diversity, equity and inclusion during#blackhistorymonth,#worldmenopauseday2023and more, our teams continued to drive positive societal change this year

Looking back at 2023 - Partnering for ImpactThere’s power in numbers – and that’s why this year, we’ve made several exciting partnerships that have had an incredible impact on skills development.

Thanks@MahaMahdii
Keep up the great work, a priority theme for the City & Guilds Foundation over the past five years.

These themes should be at the heart of a Future Skills Education system.

Tell us which one you'd like to be announced below.

Becoming an associate for@cityandguildsnot only gives professionals the chance to lend their expertise, but it also offers excellent development opportunities such as our recently created bespoke Diversity, Equity & Inclusion eLearning course.

Check out this clip taken from the episode.Many thanks to@WaltonYP@CitadelComms

It was great to have taken skills to the top at the first#SkillsHubled by@cityandguildsin collaboration with the#FutureSkillsCoalitionduring#Lab23/#CPC23So many important links between skills, productivity and growth, it was pleasing that the parties have been listening

Thanks to everyone who attended our Future Skills Coalition#Lab23reception earlier.

It was inspiring hearing speeches from the three founding organisations@cityandguilds,@AoC_info&@AELPUKand@anna4labour, as we gathered to reflect on the importance of skills.

Our first#LAB23event is about to start, and we are delighted that@SeemaMalhotra1Labour’s newly appointed shadow skills minister will join us 

Chair@HiSheriffBucks, will pose the question of what any future Government should seek to do to support the skills education agenda.
Hashtags: #LAB23, #SkillsHub: Full Programme Of Events, #SkillsHub: Full Programme Of Events

Text: Great post, thanks for sharing!
Thank you for sharing your insights with the panel!
Congratulations, well done both of you!
We can't wait to take part!
It looked like a fabulous day!
Great post for a great cause and industry!
It was our pleasure.

You're welcome, it was pleasing to witness the enthusiasm for@cityandguildsin collaboration with the Future Skills Coalition, as we made our mark for skills as a crucial part of the policy puzzle that impacts opportunity for individuals, organisations and society.
We are looking forward to exploring, amongst other things, ways to embed learning and skills development across the prison estates during the event.
Thank you for your participation. We appreciate you sharing your observations and insights.
We're delighted too that you can join us and be part of this transformative conversation that aims to create a world of second chances and new beginnings.

Shaping a skills and productivity vision for the future at#Lab23.

In collaboration with the Future Skills Coalition, our#SkillsHubwill host fringe activities - and discuss everything from the importance of lifelong learning, to apprenticeships and so much more.

Our new report explores the many benefits of high-quality workplace training, from boosting productivity to improving staff retention and progression, while also covering the major challenges L&D professionals face.

Download our report>https://ow.ly/7hUa50PP6eb

Introducing the City & Guilds Impact Report 2023! 

This report showcases the difference we're making to over 3.5M people, the organisations we work with, and the economies we impact.

Do we have a system capable of retraining people throughout their careers?

· Gaining clearer alignment with organisational goals
· Building better measurement and evaluation
· Embedding quality for greater impact.
